questions.paragraph: The cardiac muscle is an involuntary muscle. Mention the reason.
popup: Because it contracts automatically, and it cannot be consciously controlled.
Completing the digestion of food and initiating the absorption of nutrients.

questions.paragraph: Stool is not consiered an excretory material.
popup: As it is undigested food waste, it is not produced by the body's cells.

questions.paragraph: Mention a function for each of the mentioned muscles: Heart muscle - Jaw muscles - Diaphragm muscle - Intestinal muscles
popup: 1- Heart muscles: pumping blood to all body parts.
2- Jaw muscles: help teeth chewing food.
3- Diaphragm muscles: help in breathing process.

questions.paragraph: What is the reason for the diversity in the shape and size of cells in living organisms?
popup: Because each cell has a specific function, its shape and size vary according to its function.

questions.paragraph: Compare between the skin and the anus; in terms of the type of waste they expel of.
popup: Skin: It expels  soluble waste in the form of sweat.
Anus: It expels  undigested food waste (in the form of feces).

questions.paragraph: What is the way that all muscles work?
popup: Muscles work as a result of contracting and relaxing.

questions.paragraph: What is the difference between voluntary and involuntary muscles?
popup: Voluntary muscles: their movement can be controlled.
Involuntary muscles: They move automatically, and their movement cannot be consciously controlled.
